meanings.definition: A metal container with a handle and spout used for boiling water or cooking food.
meanings.sent1: I filled the kettle with water and put it on the stove to make tea.
meanings.sent2: The kettle whistled when the water started boiling.
meanings.sent3: The kettle and the pot had a race to see who could boil water faster.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like a kettle ready to boil over at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kettle gleamed in the sunlight as it sat on the kitchen counter.

meanings.definition: A group or gathering of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The bustling market was a kettle of activity with vendors and shoppers everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was a kettle of students eagerly waiting for the teacher to arrive.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion was a kettle of laughter and stories shared around the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: The protest turned into a kettle of emotions as people voiced their concerns.
meanings.sent5: The park was a kettle of colors with flowers blooming in every corner.
